events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a car collision that occurred on April 30th during rush hour, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper.
Claim has been categorized under Auto Accident following review of accident report and vehicle details provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and ensure quick communication with the claimant.
Acknowledgment of claim receipt sent to the customer with details about the next steps and required documents.
Request issued for photographs of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and a copy of the claimant’s driving license.
The claimant submitted all requested documentation including photos of the vehicle damage and the official police report.
Investigation commenced to verify circumstances of the collision and to assess liability and extent of vehicle damage.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault on the other party and validation of the claimant’s damage report.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant outlining the payout amount for vehicle repairs as per policy coverage.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the communication and support.
Claim approved officially following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement and final internal review.
Payment for the approved claim amount was processed and issued to the claimant’s designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that all claimant concerns were addressed.
All claim documentation and correspondence archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
